thread.title: Judge says Georgia's constitutional ban on same-sex marriage cannot be enforced
thread.title_full: Judge says Georgia's constitutional ban on same-sex marriage cannot be enforced

author: The Associated Press
title: Judge says Georgia's constitutional ban on same-sex marriage cannot be enforced
text:
By The Associated Press Related Articles Ralston proposes protection for Ga. clergy on gay marriage Gay marriage: Scenes from an Atlanta courthouse Metro Atlanta court begins marrying gay couples Union Co. FD mourns loss of pilot in Pickens Co. crash 
ATLANTA - A federal judge in Georgia has ruled that the state's constitutional ban on same-sex marriage cannot be enforced. 
The ruling is effectively a formality. State probate courts have been issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples since a June 26 U.S. Supreme Court ruling legalized same-sex marriage nationwide. 
Georgia's constitution prohibits same-sex marriage and says the state will recognize only the union of a man and a woman as marriage and that same-sex marriages performed in others states are not legally recognized. 
In April 2014, gay-rights group Lambda Legal filed a lawsuit challenging that ban on behalf of three couples and a widow. 
U.S. District Judge William Duffey on Wednesday signed an order ruling in their favor and saying the Supreme Court ruling means the same-sex marriage ban can't be enforced. Associated Categories : Homepage , Local/State News , Politics Associated Tags : gay marriage, U.S. Supreme Court, constitutional amendment © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com Union Co. FD mourns loss of pilot in Pickens Co. crash The Union County Fire Department in northeast Georgia said that the pilot who was killed in a plane crash Thursday in Pickens County was a volunteer firefighter who had serve with the department for more than a year and a half. 10:50AM ( 32 minutes ago ) SCOGA to hear challenge by college students who are not U.S. citizens; court to meet in Ellijay A number of college students who are not U.S. citizens are appealing a Georgia Court of Appeals decision that upheld the dismissal of their lawsuit by a Fulton County judge. The students are seeking a decision that they are entitled to in-state tuition at Georgia’s colleges and universities. 10:30AM ( 52 minutes ago ) The state playoff picture began to take a little better shape after some key matchups Friday night. 9:16AM ( 2 hours ago )
